name: Facebook Live
primary_goal_vibe: Real-time connection, Q&A, launches, and community-building through unedited interaction.
tone_preference: Human, direct, and responsive. Less polished than feed content, but still on-brand and structured.

copy_guidelines.copy_best_practices: The title and description should clearly state the topic, who it is for, and what viewers will gain. Keep the description concise and outcome-focused. During the Live, repeat the topic and CTA regularly for people who join late.
copy_guidelines.caption_structure_hint: Title: clear topic and benefit. Description: 2–4 short lines explaining what, who, and why now. Include a single primary CTA.
copy_guidelines.recommended_caption_length: Short. Text frames the live session; spoken content carries depth.
cta_examples: Follow our page for future Lives
Drop your questions in the comments
Tap the link in the description
Share this Live with your friends
Stay until the end for key takeaways

on_screen_text_guidelines.primary_role: Support late joiners and highlight key points.
best_practices: Use pinned comments to restate topic and CTA
Use short on-screen labels for segments if using external tools
Avoid cluttering the screen with too much text

hashtags_mentions.recommended_hashtags: Use a small number of relevant hashtags in the announcement post, not inside the Live.
hashtags_mentions.hashtag_strategy: Focus on topic and series consistency rather than volume.
hashtags_mentions.mention_strategy: Tag guests, partners, or co-hosts in the announcement and recap posts to extend reach.

technical_constraints.recommended_aspect_ratio: 9:16 for mobile-first, 16:9 if streaming from desktop.
technical_constraints.recommended_duration: 15–60 minutes depending on topic and audience size.
technical_constraints.connection_note: Test connection, audio, and framing before going Live.
technical_constraints.safe_area_note: Keep faces and key visuals away from areas covered by comments and UI overlays.

required_elements: Single main CTA repeated during the session
Opening hook explaining what viewers gain by staying
disallowed_practices: Long periods of silence or idle time
Clickbait titles unrelated to the actual content
